item.title: [ 57] /pcbg/ - PC Building General
item.description:
>NEWS
https://videocardz.com/newz/nvidia-restricts-gefoce-rtx-5060-press-drivers-no-reviews-at-launch
Scamvidia hiding the 5060 from reviewers so their scam isn't exposed on launch day.

>UPGRADE & BUILD ADVICE.
Post build list or current specs including MONITOR: https://pcpartpicker.com/
Provide specific use cases.
State BUDGET and COUNTRY or you will NOT be helped.
Building guide: https://wiki.installgentoo.com/index.php/Build_a_PC

>CASE (from $ to $$$)
mATX: Asus Prime AP201, Lian Li A3, O11 Air Mini
ATX: Phanteks XT PRO (ULTRA), Montech AIR 903 Base/MAX, Lian Li Lancool 207, Antec C8, Antec Flux Pro
AVOID: NXZT, 'Silent' cases, fanless cases, Corsair 6500

>CPU
Budget: 9600X, 7600X, 7500f
Gaming: AMD X3D
Workstation: 9950X, 7950X
AVOID Shittel

>COOLER
AIO: Best Value: Thermalright Frozen Prism, Premium LCD: Lian Li Galahad II LCD
Double towers: Thermalright Phantom Spirit 120 SE, Noctua NH-D15 G2
ITX/>42mm RAM: Scythe Fuma 3/TR AXP120-X67

>MOTHERBOARD
ASRock B850M-X, ASRock B850 LiveMixer WiFi, ASRock X870 Pro RS, ASRock Phantom Gaming X870E Nova WiFi

>RAM
DDR4: 2x16GB 3200CL16. Budget, 2x8GB
DDR5: 2x16GB 6000CL30
Workstation/high end: consider 2x32GB

>SSD (OS drive)
Budget: Silicon Power UD90
Mid range: SN770
Premium: SN850X
Flagship: Sabrent Rocket 5

>GPU
1080p: No VRAM: RTX 5060 TI 8GB, Fake Frames: RTX 5060 TI 16GB, Real Performance: RX 9060 XT
1440p: Fake Frames: RTX 5070 TI, Real Performance: RX 9070 XT, Budget: RX 9060 XT
4K: Fire Starter: RTX 5090, Scam Enjoyer: RTX 5080, Affordable: 9070 XT
Value For Money: AVOID Ngreedia cards
ALWAYS pair AMD GPUs with AMD CPUs for SAM https://imgur.com/a/7XecPGL

>PSU
https://hwbusters.com/best_picks/best-atxv3-pcie5-ready-psus-picks-hardware-busters/

>MONITOR
https://pcmonitors.info/recommendations/

>OS
Activate Windows @ >>>/g/fwt

>CASE FANS
Meta: Case with good stock PWM fans
Mid range: Arctic P12/P14
High end: Noctua NF-A12x25, Noctua NF-A14x25 G2

Previous: >>105202858

Original filename: 6782621c9df11f527a71ea92689f4012ac1e9f6acb7f23c305567d65a0007866.png

item.title: [ 80] What happened to Splatoon?
item.description:
Splatoon 3 was great but for some reason it just kinda fell off for me. It just didn't stick like 1 and 2 did.
I can't put my finger on it but it's kind of feels like how Animal Crossing New Horizons didn't stick with me.

item.title: [ 84] /lmg/ - Local Models General
item.description:
/lmg/ - a general dedicated to the discussion and development of local language models.

Previous threads: >>105196240 & >>105189179

►News
>(05/06) Absolute Zero reasoning training code released: https://github.com/LeapLabTHU/Absolute-Zero-Reasoner
>(05/06) ACE-Step released, 3.5B hybrid music generation model: https://hf.co/ACE-Step/ACE-Step-v1-3.5B
>(05/04) FormalMATH benchmark dataset for formal mathematical reasoning released: https://hf.co/datasets/SphereLab/FormalMATH-All
>(05/02) Granite 4.0 preview 7B released: https://hf.co/ibm-granite/granite-4.0-tiny-preview

►News Archive: https://rentry.org/lmg-news-archive
►Glossary: https://rentry.org/lmg-glossary
►Links: https://rentry.org/LocalModelsLinks
►Official /lmg/ card: https://files.catbox.moe/cbclyf.png

►Getting Started
https://rentry.org/lmg-lazy-getting-started-guide
https://rentry.org/lmg-build-guides
https://rentry.org/IsolatedLinuxWebService
https://rentry.org/tldrhowtoquant
https://rentry.org/samplers

►Further Learning
https://rentry.org/machine-learning-roadmap
https://rentry.org/llm-training

►Benchmarks
LiveBench: https://livebench.ai
Programming: https://livecodebench.github.io/leaderboard.html
Code Editing: https://aider.chat/docs/leaderboards

GPUs: https://github.com/XiongjieDai/GPU-Benchmarks-on-LLM-Inference

►Tools

GGUF VRAM Calculator: https://hf.co/spaces/NyxKrage/LLM-Model-VRAM-Calculator
Sampler Visualizer: https://artefact2.github.io/llm-sampling

item.title: [ 40] /nrl/ - Rugby League General - Friday Night Footy - round 10
item.description:
Still friends edition

NRL
>GAME 1
Newcastle Knights v Gold Coast Titans
6:00pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
McDonald Jones Stadium, Newcastle
1.46-2.74
>The Knights returned to the winner's list with an impressive win at Magic Round, while the Titans will be boosted by the return of Jayden Campbell. Newcastle ended a five-match losing streak with a dominant Magic Round 30-4 demolition of the Rabbitohs, breaking a losing run that started with a 26-6 defeat to the Titans in round 3. Gold Coast have now lost five straight, including a 20 point loss to the Bulldogs last weekend, and sit 16th on the ladder. The Titans defeated the Knights 26-6 earlier this season, but have not beaten them in Newcastle in their last six attempts, with their last win over the Knights at this venue being back in 2016.
Knights 1-12 2.85
Knights 13+ 2.60
Titans 1-12 3.75
Titans 13+ 7.00
Knights -6.5 1.96 Titans +5.5 1.85

>GAME 2
South Sydney Rabbitohs v Brisbane Broncos
8:05pm AEST on Fox, Kayo and Ch9
Accor Stadium, Sydney
3.82-1.27
>A nice coaching twist to this game. Wayne Bennett guided the Broncos to six titles & Michael Maguire was successful in 2014 with the Rabbitohs. South Sydney’s woes continued with a 30-4 defeat to Newcastle, their fourth in a row and keeping them anchored near the bottom of the table. Brisbane followed up a commanding win over ladder-leaders Canterbury with a deflating 32-8 loss to the Panthers. Ezra Mam’s nine-week suspension is over, but he returns via Queensland Cup. The Rabbitohs have been dominant in recent H2H meetings at Accor Stadium, winning four out of five, with the Broncos victorious on only two occasions.
Rabbitohs 1-12 4.80
Rabbitohs 13+ 10.50
Broncos 1-12 2.90
Broncos 13+ 2.02
Rabbitohs +10.5 1.88 Broncos -10.5 1.92

Original filename: Friends.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 54] US-UK Trade Deal
item.description:
UK and US announce trade deal to save thousands of British jobs, Starmer says

https://news.sky.com/story/uk-and-us-agree-trade-deal-as-starmer-and-trump-make-announcement-in-live-phone-call-13363710

The UK and US have agreed a trade deal, with Sir Keir Starmer and Donald Trump confirming the announcement during a live televised phone call.

It is the first trade deal agreed after Mr Trump began his second presidential term in January, and after he imposed strict tariffs on countries around the world in April.

Sir Keir said the "first-of-a-kind" deal with the US will save thousands of jobs across the UK, boost British business and protect British industry.

Original filename: starmer_trump.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 66] /cfb/ - Not so fast! edition
item.description:
>Michigan Coach Suspension
Sherrone Moore faces a reported two-game suspension due to the Connor Stalions scandal, missing games against Central Michigan and Nebraska but allowed to coach against Oklahoma.

>Lee Corso’s Retirement
Longtime ESPN College GameDay analyst Lee Corso will retire after Week 1 of the 2025 season, marking the end of an era.

>NCAA Governance Changes Proposed
NCAA President Charlie Baker announced plans for a new governance structure to be released in July, granting individual sports more control over their rules and policies. This aims to give Power 4 conferences greater influence.

>House v. NCAA Settlement Update
A new brief in the House v. NCAA case includes provisions to grandfather in athletes affected by roster cuts for the 2025-26 season, allowing reinstatement at schools' discretion.

>Nico Iamaleava Transfer Drama
Former Tennessee QB Nico Iamaleava’s transfer to UCLA continues to make waves, with Arkansas’ NIL collective seeking a $200K buyout from him and another player.

>Clemson’s Unique Addition
Ian Schieffelin, a basketball player, accepted coach Dabo Swinney’s offer to join Clemson’s football team, forgoing pro basketball for now.

>Transfer Portal Highlights
The spring transfer window closed, but top uncommitted prospects remain, with teams like UNLV and Tulane boosting rosters for playoff hopes.

>Recruiting News
The Class of 2026 five-star recruits are shaping up, with May expected to bring significant commitments.

Original filename: Sherrone Moore.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 75] FED LEAVES RATES UNCHANGED!!!
item.description:
>GDP contracting
>Inflation <2% and probably in deflation
>Cost to borrow strangling the economy
>Housing market in worst situation in decades
>Home purchasing at all time lows
>Confidence near all time lows

item.title: [122] Pizza is American.
item.description:
The original pizza was ONLY known in Naples, not even in all of Italy. If you asked for pizza to someone from Rome, Venice, Sicily, Milan, Turin, Genoa, Florence or Bologna, they wouldn't what were you even talking about.
It was a small flat bread that fits in your hand with some oil and tomato sauce on top. It wasn't a culinary delicacy Neapolitan grandmas made, it was a cheap street food that working class men would consume just to eat something. Not that popular in Naples either.
It was Neapolitan immigrants who came to New York who made what we know as pizza now. When they arrive to New York, because they had more money and could afford more, started making pizzas bigger to the point that it had to be divided in slices for one to eat and started adding more ingredients to make it more savory like cheese, slices of pepperoni, onions, peppers, various meats and veggies; then started experimenting more with pizza when more Italians migrated to other cities.
When this happened around the late 1800s and early 1900s in the USA, Italy still didn't know what a pizza was overall, it was still the small pathetic flat bread with some tomato sauce on and olive oil on top. It was all the way until the 1980s where pizza started growing as a staple food in Italy, thanks to tourists asking for pizza and American pizza brands arriving there. Eventually starting evolving into their own way. But it is important to note that it was because of the USA.
The pizza we all know and love IS American, not Italian. Pizza IS American. It evolved in the USA, became a thing in the USA and got popular worldwide because of the USA.
Pizza is American.

Original filename: crisp-pepperoni.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 36] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG – you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

GENERAL INFO:
https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.
